<summary>What's your diagnosis</summary>

Fibrous dysplasia

</details>

<details close>

<summary>Notes</summary>
<br>

**Definition:** Benign fibroosseous lesion; mono- and polyostotic form <br><br>

**Epidemiology:** <br>Females and Males equally affected.
<br><br>
**Microscopy:** <br> Bland fibroblast-like spindle cells. <br>Multinucleated giant cells may be present (secondary AKZ-like changes). <br>Myxomatous areas may be present. <br>Irregular woven bone often described as forming pattern resembling chinese characters <br>Osteoblastic rimming of the bony trabeculae is often absent. <br><br>
**Molecular pathology:** <br> GNAS1 (exon 8 and 9) in 45–93% of cases.<br><br>
**Syndroms:**McCune-Albright syndrome (endocrine abnormalities, café au lait spots) and Mazabraud syndrome (soft tissue myxomas)
<br>
**References:** <br>https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC5563825/ <br>
https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/bonefibrousdysplasia.html
